Text: Well, you simply make sure `display()` sits inside `render()`, and `this.state.allProductsDummy` inside `display()`
Hello, thanks for your reply. I actually tried that but when I did that, when I click, it doesn't check any :( I'll update the code to show you what I did @kenmistry
Do you know that `render()` is auto called for you everytime `state` changed?
With select2 there isn't an option element to the multiselect.

instead of having the same state for both checkboxes, you'll need separate states for this. can you try adding states `checked1` and `checked2`, arranging them accordingly to their respective checkboxes?
